p: Interactions between sectors (e.g. agriculture, forestry, water) are important in determining climate change impacts ( Harrison et al., 2016, Elliott et al., 2014, Piontek et al., 2014). In CCRA2017, a very broad systems boundary was needed in order to draw the most robust conclusions possible. Where quantitative information on interactions was not available, those relationships were assessed using existing literature. Studies that focus on interactions often fill key knowledge gaps. Guzman et al. (this issue) provide an exemplar study of interactions between crop cultivation, irrigation and groundwater. Elliott et al. (this issue) provide an exemplar study of economic impacts by assessing the insured and uninsured crop losses resulting from drought.
